location.name: Remote in DC AREA. Occasional travel to Ashburn, is required

title: Information Security Analyst
content:
Information Security Analyst #694
Clearance:  Must possess active clearance from Department of Homeland Security (Headquarters or U.S. Customs and Border Protection preferred). 
Have you been looking for a foot in the door of the cybersecurity field? Dev Technology Group is looking for a new Information Security Analyst that might be a fit for you. Our Security team includes Information System Security Officers (ISSOs), Security Analysts and Security Engineers that support a government customer in ensuring strong security policies are created, managed and overseen by the intelligent use of management and monitoring tools. This is a user-facing role, so bring your good communication skills and customer service attitude, along with an attention to detail and the desire to get things right. 
Responsibilities: 

Support Account Access Control administrative duties
Troubleshoot AIX account problems
Support Account certification processes
Identify new and better ways to achieve your goals
Learn the security domain to grow into new responsibilities

Required Skills and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree plus 2 years of working experience in the IT industry or project-based environments (can include internships) 
Experience creating queries to prepare reports/data for tasks such as account recertification, data validation and audit requirements
Familiarity with Account Access Control processes
Experience compiling data from various sources into executive-level summary presentations
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel including experience with advanced formulas, charts and graphs, along with a good working knowledge of the Microsoft 365 suite of applications
Demonstrates great analytical and problem-solving skills to detect and resolve security issues
Demonstrates good communication skills, including verbal and written
Ability to provide effective customer service, showing understanding for the user and working to resolve their problems
Ability to work under tight schedules to meet deadlines
Must enjoy detail-oriented work
Ability to collaborate with team members to ensure client needs and expectations are met or exceeded
Ability to work independently while consulting with a more senior team member
Ability to learn new skills as needed, being proactive and looking ahead to the next need

Preferred Skills and Experience:

Familiarity with Unix, able to execute simple Unix commands to troubleshoot AIX account problems (ability to learn is required)
Familiarity with the usage of Business Intelligence and Analytics tools (Microsoft Power BI, SAP BusinessObjects, Tableau or similar) to facilitate management reporting
Knowledge of Microsoft Access Database
Experience with audits of data files
Who We Are
Dev Technology is a growing IT company with an employee-centric culture that works on mission-critical projects for the federal government. We partner with our federal customers to deliver technology services and solutions, and to drive our client’s missions forward through innovation. We use Agile and DevSecOps principles to provide services including application development, biometrics and identity management, cloud and infrastructure optimization, IT and legacy modernization, and data management.   
As a Washington Post Top Workplace award winner for the past ten years in a row, the Top Workplaces USA for the past three years, and a recipient of the Companies As Responsive Employers (CARE) Award for the past four years, Dev Technology employees enjoy:   

Generous and flexible time-off policy
Flexible work schedules and telework options, including remote work availability for eligible projects
Career development opportunities including a mentorship program, technical and management training through Dev University, hands-on learning through DevLab, tuition reimbursement, and paid training opportunities
Industry-leading benefits including a choice of two health plans that include dental and vision, flexible spending account, commuter benefits, life insurance, and more
401K matching with immediate vesting and end of year profit sharing  
Regular team and company social events including our annual party, happy hours, fitness challenges, and more  
A focus on community engagement including company wide support activities, employer match for donations, and time off for volunteer efforts
To learn more about working at Dev Technology visit, Learn About A Day At Dev Technology

 
Dev Technology Group operates in the following states: AL, AR, AZ, CO, DC, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, MD, MA, ME, MN, NC, NJ, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, VA, WV.
 
EEO/AA/Disability/Vets Employer

questions.label: This position requires a government security clearance that requires a US Citizenship. Are you a US Citizen?
Please provide your salary expectations for this role.
This s a hybrid position with some on site days required when we return to the office. Are you IN THE DC AREA and able to commute to the job location in Ashburn, VA?
Do you currently hold a government security clearance with the Department of Homeland Security or CBP?
If you have an active Department of Homeland Security clearance what type of security clearance do you currently hold?
Please tell us how you first heard of Dev Technology Group (i.e. Event, Referral, Social Media Post, Job Ad Post, etc.)
As a government contractor, we require every employee to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Are you able to meet this requirement?

This position involves working on a contract for the US Government.  The US Government requires US citizenship for this position.  

*This position cannot support a Work Visa or Green Card status.  Providing false information regarding your US Citizenship status on this application will result in your application being rejected for this opportunity.

Can you meet this requirement?
